title: Ticket #6870: scitokens: remote starter does not get credentials from shadow
description:
When a job with tokens lands on a remote execute machine, the tokens do not get transferred correctly. The starter complains about: 

01/17/19 16:15:57 CREDMON: got cred
01/17/19 16:15:57 CREDMON: writing data to /etc/batch_credds/jpatton.cred.tmp
01/17/19 16:15:57 CREDMON: failed to decode credential into file (/etc/batch_credds/jpatton.cred)!

These messages are generated from lines 2736-2765 in /src/condor_starter.V6.1/jic_shadow.cpp .

The full StarterLog.slotX for the job looks like this: 

01/17/19 16:15:57 Result of reading /etc/issue:  \S
01/17/19 16:15:57 Result of reading /etc/redhat-release:  CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core)

01/17/19 16:15:57 ERROR: AUTHENTICATE:1003:Failed to authenticate with any method|AUTHENTICATE:1004:Failed to authenticate using GSI|GSI:5003:Failed to authenticate.  Globus is reporting error (851968:50).  There is probably a problem with your credentials.  (Did you run grid-proxy-init?)|AUTHENTICATE:1004:Failed to authenticate using KERBEROS|AUTHENTICATE:1004:Failed to authenticate using FS
01/17/19 16:15:57 Failed to send CREDD_GET_PASSWD command to shadow
01/17/19 16:15:57 CREDMON: got cred
01/17/19 16:15:57 CREDMON: writing data to /etc/batch_credds/jpatton.cred.tmp
01/17/19 16:15:57 CREDMON: failed to decode credential into file (/etc/batch_credds/jpatton.cred)!
01/17/19 16:15:57 Failed to initialize JobInfoCommunicator, aborting
01/17/19 16:15:57 Unable to start job.
01/17/19 16:15:57 **** condor_starter (condor_STARTER) pid 308 EXITING WITH STATUS 1
01/17/19 16:15:57 Deleting the StarterHookMgr

It appears as if the job is trying to get more than just OAuth tokens with SendCredential=true having been set automatically in the job ad, though it's not clear that the extra credential request is the problem.

2019-Jan-17 10:51:06 by bbockelm:
I think this might be the same as #6867: when the remote starter fails to talk to the credd (in your case, it appears the starter has failed to authenticate with the credd), the code ignores the error code and tries to execute the code anyway.

2019-Jan-17 12:03:17 by jfrey:
It looks like your starter is failing through to the pre-SciTokens credential transfer code, and you need to set TOKENS=True in the config to use the new transfer code.

2019-Jan-17 13:16:32 by jpatton:
Per Brian, ToddT, and Jaime's findings, the major issue here is what was laid out in #6867 (the condor_starter ignores token transfer errors due to non-encrypted transfer), but we'll track progress in this ticket.

We also need to document that TOKENS (or whatever it ends up being called) should be set True on the execute machine as well as the submit machine to enable the token transfer mechanism, and that the daemons must be authenticated. But, per #6869, the new token transfer mechanism should not be the only method for transferring credentials.

2019-Feb-01 14:12:21 by jpatton:
Since this was actually #6867, it was resolved in #6867. This ticket remains for documentation purposes.
creator: jpatton
